sv.desc: Boolean flag that if true indicates that the system is speacking
fraction of the system utterance being said that has been currently spoken. Updated at each timer interval.
Boolean flag that if true indicates that the user is speacking
Number of seconds the user has spoken last.
Number of seconds the user has spoken since the last system intervention.
BBN Minat triage class.
BBN Minat distress labels.
Time in seconds since the last thing said by the user.
Time in seconds since the last thing said by the system.
Number of consecutive user actions for which the system had no direct response (handler) across the entire dialogue.
Number of consecutive user actions to which the system didn't have an handler within the same user turn.
Time in seconds since anyone said something (user or system).
Time in seconds since the last resource link/video was given.
Time in seconds since the login event.
Name of last speech act received by the system. After the search is done, it contains the single speech act dealt by the selected network.
Name of last speech act received by the system. Not affected by search selection.
Name of last sub-dialog executed by the system.
Name of the speech act last said by the system.
Time in seconds between 2 consecutive timer events.
If true and a form is available for the current system speech act, the form will be selected by the NLG.
Variable used to store the input event that generated one of the internal events (e.g. unhandled, ignore and loop).
Stores a list of lists of NLUEvents received by the character. The first is the most recent (stack). When a system event is received the next incoming user events are collected in a new list element.
Stores the last text the user said, as received by the DM.
